title: Firefox & Word Files in Read-only Mode
content:
This problem has only occurred in the last 24 hours:

a) I access a Word file with Firefox (maybe an e-mail attachment, maybe directly from an e-learning site); I tell Firefox to Open With Word 365; the file opens, but only in Read-only mode - I cannot edit the document at all; I cannot change this status from within Word 365.

b) I access the very same file from the very same source but now tell Firefox to Save File to my Desktop; I then open the file with Word 365 - it opens 'normally'; I can edit the document straight away.

Yesterday, it did not matter if I did a) or b), I could always edit the document straight away (Read-only was never 'forced' on me).

As extra background, I have turned off every Protected View feature in Word 365 which I can find - does not help at all.

I want to be able to go back to option a): Open With Word 365, NOT have 'Read-only' & be able to edit the document immediately.
creator: SCW

title: Avoid object properties being sorted alphabetically in inspector
content:
How can avoid that object properties are sorted alphabetically in the inspector? They are not sorted alphabetically in the snippets shown in the code area (e.g. properties of the snippet of the "s" object in the code area in the attached picture are "c", "b", "d", etc) but then they are sorted alphabetically in the inspector (e.g. properties of "s" object in the inspector in the attached picture are "a", "b", "c", "d", etc)

I tried setting devtools.inspector.sorting to false, but they are still sorted alphabetically.

Thanks in advance for your help

title: Firefox can't open portal chooser/file explorer in Ubuntu
content:
I need help solving a technical issue that prevents Firefox from opening the file explorer (Nautilus) in Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS.

A couple days back, Firefox stopped working the way it is intended, no external packages have been installed other than regular Ubuntu's updates, I can't save an image or open the file explorer through Firefox. I tried other web browsers and they work great, which makes me believe that the problem is not related to the file explorer itself.

I tried restarting Firefox default's configuration as suggested here, reinstalling Firefox through CLI using the command sudo apt install --reinstall firefox and uninstalling and then installing back again using Ubuntu's software application.

After trying everything explained before, I launched firefox through CLI just to see if any error messages would appear, results are attached. I can't import/export bookmarks either, nothing happens after clicking it, which I guess it should open the file explorer so you select the backup file, but no errors are shown (maybe in a more verbose debug mode?).

I had to use a different browser to be able to attach the screenshots as in Firefox clicking the 'Browse...' button to add them does nothing. Also, I just tried launching Firefox in troubleshooting mode from Help > Troubleshooting mode but the problem persists.

Please let me know if you need more information.
creator: ale-jimenez1

title: All Kinds of stuff honestly
content: I initially had trouble because a website for school, called Wiley,com, or Wiley Plus, was having trouble. Specifically, i could most things and when I would attempt to open a homework assignment, Id get an error. According to my professor, it was a Firefox issue, and he was right, when I went to Google, which I hate, it worked just fine. Then slowly, there were more problems opening up my school website or my bitwarden extension would have issues. So today, I finally uninstalled, and reinstalled. Which, unfortunately, I have had to do with Firefox twice before. Frustrating, but I hate Google enough that I chalked it up. Then, after this most current reinstall, it completely screwed things up with my bitwarden extension and bitwarden themselves, because for some reason, Firefox is sending weird info that freaks websites out. Outside of the extensions, it often cant open sites, or sites tell me something is happening. I have Norton and have scanned my device repeatedly, and gone so far as to contact them and my computer is clean. What...is going on. I STILL haven't sorted out the Bitwarden fiasco and have had to contact their support, but honestly, the problem CAME from the firefox browser. I dont know how to fix this
